Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-635: Added MongoInterruptedException, a runtime exception that wraps an InterruptedException.  An instance of this class is thrown in cases where the driver is sleeping or waiting on a condition, and has to catch InterruptedException and do something besides swallowing it.  Since InterruptedException is checked and so can't be thrown from methods that don't declare it, best thing to do it throw a runtime exception that can be handled in the application

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1156: Properly ensure that none of the server-defined limits on the write commands are exceeded. There is one limit for the number of items that are allowed in each command (maxWriteBatchSize from ismaster). There is a second limit for the number of bytes in the encoded message (maxBsonObjectSize from ismaster), with an exception for a write command containing just a single item, which is allowed to exceed that limit.

Comment: JAVA-682: Added three new classes--MongoClient, MongoClientOptions, and MongoClientURI, all of which have a default write concern that waits for acknowledgement of the write from the server.  MongoClient extends Mongo so that it's easy to switch to it just by changing which class is constructed.  MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: agirbal
Comment: [JAVA-293]: Cursor is not closed after limit is fully fetched from server. This turned out to be more of a refactoring than hoped, to clean up code while fixing issue. Solution: - positive batchsize tells server the ideal size of a batch returned - negative batchsize tells server to return 1 batch of maximum that size, or whatever fits in a 4MB batch, and close the cursor - positive limit does limit the total number of documents to return on cursor. Once limit is reached, cursor should be called automatically by driver. - negative limit is only supported for legacy reason. It sets the batchSize to that negative value.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-436: When a database and credentials are specified in the Mongo URI, automatically authenticate the database.  This is done lazily on first use of the database by just setting the credentials on the DB instance. Care is taken to make sure that DB.authenticate and DB.authenticateCommand still work correctly even if credentials are on the URI, so long as the same credentials are used in all cases.  Otherwise clients who were working around this by calling those methods explicitly would break.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-757: Adding a new MongoException subclass called WriteConcernException, which DuplicateKey now extends. WriteConcernException takes the command result and passes toString() of it to MongoException, so the JSON representation of the entire document will appear in logs, instead of just the err" field"

Comment: JAVA-691: Finished SASL support. 1. Added support for authProtocol and authSource in MongoClientURI 2. Added support for passing a credentials store to MongoClient containing all the credentials that are needed by this client 3. Re-implemented DB.authenticate using the credentials store and a new authenticate command in DBTCPConnector.  This removes the redundancy in DB and DBPort 4. Added support for negotiated authentication protocol specified by Protocol.STRONGEST

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-436: If a database is not specified in the URI but credentials are, authenticate to the admin database

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-436: When a database and credentials are specified in the Mongo URI, automatically authenticate the database.  This is done lazily on first use of the database by just setting the credentials on the DB instance. Care is taken to make sure that DB.authenticate and DB.authenticateCommand still work correctly even if credentials are on the URI, so long as the same credentials are used in all cases.  Otherwise clients who were working around this by calling those methods explicitly would break.

Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Comment: Changed testng.xml to run tests in all packages under com.mongodb and org.bson, instead of explicitly naming test classes.  This is less error prone, since committers have not always added new test classes to testng.xml.  Now unit tests run a lot more tests.  Two tests that weren't running before are failing, so I commented them out.  For one there is a known bug which is referenced, the other I'm still debugging with the committer.

It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Comment: JAVA-682: Added three new classes--MongoClient, MongoClientOptions, and MongoClientURI, all of which have a default write concern that waits for acknowledgement of the write from the server.  MongoClient extends Mongo so that it's easy to switch to it just by changing which class is constructed.  MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-381: Added MongosStatus class as a sibling to ReplicaSetStatus to handle mongos failover. Refactored ReplicaSetStatus and MongosStatus to share a common base class ConnectionStatus. Added DynamicConnectionStatus class to handle dynamic discovery of whether a list of seed nodes represents a bunch of mongos servers or a replicaset. Is uses ExecutorService to handle multiple threads that communicate with each member of the seed list. Changed DBTCPConnection to depend on DynamicConnectionStatus insteand of ReplicaSetStatus.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: Fixed a number of issues with LazyBSONObject class 1. Changed sizeCString method to that is assume offset is on the first character of the cstring, not the character preceding it, and adjusted all called to account for that 2. Changed name of LazyBSONIterator to LazyBSONKeyIterator and made it package private, since it should not be public. 3. Changed implemenation of the get(String key) method so that it doesn't require the creation an an array of ElementRecord for all preceding keys, just to get the value of this key 4. Added a getElements method that return an array of all fields, for use by LazyBSONList 5. Fixed a buffer overrun that will occur when the document contains a field of type BSON.REGEX

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: Fixed a number of issues with LazyBSONObject class 1. Changed sizeCString method to that is assume offset is on the first character of the cstring, not the character preceding it, and adjusted all called to account for that 2. Changed name of LazyBSONIterator to LazyBSONKeyIterator and made it package private, since it should not be public. 3. Changed implemenation of the get(String key) method so that it doesn't require the creation an an array of ElementRecord for all preceding keys, just to get the value of this key 4. Added a getElements method that return an array of all fields, for use by LazyBSONList 5. Fixed a buffer overrun that will occur when the document contains a field of type BSON.REGEX

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-635: Added MongoInterruptedException, a runtime exception that wraps an InterruptedException.  An instance of this class is thrown in cases where the driver is sleeping or waiting on a condition, and has to catch InterruptedException and do something besides swallowing it.  Since InterruptedException is checked and so can't be thrown from methods that don't declare it, best thing to do it throw a runtime exception that can be handled in the application

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Comment: JAVA-757: Adding a new MongoException subclass called WriteConcernException, which DuplicateKey now extends. WriteConcernException takes the command result and passes toString() of it to MongoException, so the JSON representation of the entire document will appear in logs, instead of just the err" field"

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Finished SASL support. 1. Added support for authProtocol and authSource in MongoClientURI 2. Added support for passing a credentials store to MongoClient containing all the credentials that are needed by this client 3. Re-implemented DB.authenticate using the credentials store and a new authenticate command in DBTCPConnector.  This removes the redundancy in DB and DBPort 4. Added support for negotiated authentication protocol specified by Protocol.STRONGEST

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-706: Wrap command in $query field if sending to mongos and read preference is not primary or secondaryPreferred (primary is the default and secondaryPreferred is already covered by slaveOk bit).

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-436: When a database and credentials are specified in the Mongo URI, automatically authenticate the database.  This is done lazily on first use of the database by just setting the credentials on the DB instance. Care is taken to make sure that DB.authenticate and DB.authenticateCommand still work correctly even if credentials are on the URI, so long as the same credentials are used in all cases.  Otherwise clients who were working around this by calling those methods explicitly would break.

Author: agirbal
Comment: [JAVA-293]: Cursor is not closed after limit is fully fetched from server. This turned out to be more of a refactoring than hoped, to clean up code while fixing issue. Solution: - positive batchsize tells server the ideal size of a batch returned - negative batchsize tells server to return 1 batch of maximum that size, or whatever fits in a 4MB batch, and close the cursor - positive limit does limit the total number of documents to return on cursor. Once limit is reached, cursor should be called automatically by driver. - negative limit is only supported for legacy reason. It sets the batchSize to that negative value.

Comment: JAVA-682: All MongoClient constructors now get default options from MongoClientOptions instead of MongoOptions.  So the job of setting the default writeConcern is now delegated to MongoClientOptions instead of handled explicitly by MongoClient

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-682: Added three new classes--MongoClient, MongoClientOptions, and MongoClientURI, all of which have a default write concern that waits for acknowledgement of the write from the server.  MongoClient extends Mongo so that it's easy to switch to it just by changing which class is constructed.  MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-381: Added MongosStatus class as a sibling to ReplicaSetStatus to handle mongos failover. Refactored ReplicaSetStatus and MongosStatus to share a common base class ConnectionStatus. Added DynamicConnectionStatus class to handle dynamic discovery of whether a list of seed nodes represents a bunch of mongos servers or a replicaset. Is uses ExecutorService to handle multiple threads that communicate with each member of the seed list. Changed DBTCPConnection to depend on DynamicConnectionStatus insteand of ReplicaSetStatus.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-635: Added MongoInterruptedException, a runtime exception that wraps an InterruptedException.  An instance of this class is thrown in cases where the driver is sleeping or waiting on a condition, and has to catch InterruptedException and do something besides swallowing it.  Since InterruptedException is checked and so can't be thrown from methods that don't declare it, best thing to do it throw a runtime exception that can be handled in the application

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-666, JAVA-641: Created two subclasses of DBPortPool: MongoConnectionPool and Java5MongoConnectionPool.  The former is an MBean and the latter is an MXBean.  When creating a DBPortPool, conditionally create one or the other depending on whether java.version system property indicates that this is a 1.5 virtual machine.  This should avoid JXM registration errors when running on Java 5 VMs. Also, by using MongoConnectionPool as the name of the MXBean, avoids incompatibilities in JMX implementations that require the MXBean name to be the same as the MXBean interface that it implements (minus the MXBean suffix).

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Comment: JAVA-682: Added three new classes--MongoClient, MongoClientOptions, and MongoClientURI, all of which have a default write concern that waits for acknowledgement of the write from the server.  MongoClient extends Mongo so that it's easy to switch to it just by changing which class is constructed.  MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: agirbal
Comment: [JAVA-293]: Cursor is not closed after limit is fully fetched from server. This turned out to be more of a refactoring than hoped, to clean up code while fixing issue. Solution: - positive batchsize tells server the ideal size of a batch returned - negative batchsize tells server to return 1 batch of maximum that size, or whatever fits in a 4MB batch, and close the cursor - positive limit does limit the total number of documents to return on cursor. Once limit is reached, cursor should be called automatically by driver. - negative limit is only supported for legacy reason. It sets the batchSize to that negative value.

Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Comment: JAVA-641: Added MongoOptions property to control whether driver always uses MBeans.  The default is false, in which case the driver will use MXBeans on Java 6 or greater

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-666, JAVA-641: Created two subclasses of DBPortPool: MongoConnectionPool and Java5MongoConnectionPool.  The former is an MBean and the latter is an MXBean.  When creating a DBPortPool, conditionally create one or the other depending on whether java.version system property indicates that this is a 1.5 virtual machine.  This should avoid JXM registration errors when running on Java 5 VMs. Also, by using MongoConnectionPool as the name of the MXBean, avoids incompatibilities in JMX implementations that require the MXBean name to be the same as the MXBean interface that it implements (minus the MXBean suffix).

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-666, JAVA-641: Created two subclasses of DBPortPool: MongoConnectionPool and Java5MongoConnectionPool.  The former is an MBean and the latter is an MXBean.  When creating a DBPortPool, conditionally create one or the other depending on whether java.version system property indicates that this is a 1.5 virtual machine.  This should avoid JXM registration errors when running on Java 5 VMs. Also, by using MongoConnectionPool as the name of the MXBean, avoids incompatibilities in JMX implementations that require the MXBean name to be the same as the MXBean interface that it implements (minus the MXBean suffix).

Author: Bryan Reinero
Comment: Java-574 New SemaphoresOut constructor accepting int which caller can define number of allowed permits.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-635: Added MongoInterruptedException, a runtime exception that wraps an InterruptedException.  An instance of this class is thrown in cases where the driver is sleeping or waiting on a condition, and has to catch InterruptedException and do something besides swallowing it.  Since InterruptedException is checked and so can't be thrown from methods that don't declare it, best thing to do it throw a runtime exception that can be handled in the application

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Comment: JAVA-381: Added MongosStatus class as a sibling to ReplicaSetStatus to handle mongos failover. Refactored ReplicaSetStatus and MongosStatus to share a common base class ConnectionStatus. Added DynamicConnectionStatus class to handle dynamic discovery of whether a list of seed nodes represents a bunch of mongos servers or a replicaset. Is uses ExecutorService to handle multiple threads that communicate with each member of the seed list. Changed DBTCPConnection to depend on DynamicConnectionStatus insteand of ReplicaSetStatus.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1156: Properly ensure that none of the server-defined limits on the write commands are exceeded. There is one limit for the number of items that are allowed in each command (maxWriteBatchSize from ismaster). There is a second limit for the number of bytes in the encoded message (maxBsonObjectSize from ismaster), with an exception for a write command containing just a single item, which is allowed to exceed that limit.

Comment: JAVA-691: Finished SASL support. 1. Added support for authProtocol and authSource in MongoClientURI 2. Added support for passing a credentials store to MongoClient containing all the credentials that are needed by this client 3. Re-implemented DB.authenticate using the credentials store and a new authenticate command in DBTCPConnector.  This removes the redundancy in DB and DBPort 4. Added support for negotiated authentication protocol specified by Protocol.STRONGEST

Author: seanjreilly
Comment: DBCursor.next() throws NoSuchElementException

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-436: When a database and credentials are specified in the Mongo URI, automatically authenticate the database.  This is done lazily on first use of the database by just setting the credentials on the DB instance. Care is taken to make sure that DB.authenticate and DB.authenticateCommand still work correctly even if credentials are on the URI, so long as the same credentials are used in all cases.  Otherwise clients who were working around this by calling those methods explicitly would break.

Author: agirbal
Comment: [JAVA-293]: Cursor is not closed after limit is fully fetched from server. This turned out to be more of a refactoring than hoped, to clean up code while fixing issue. Solution: - positive batchsize tells server the ideal size of a batch returned - negative batchsize tells server to return 1 batch of maximum that size, or whatever fits in a 4MB batch, and close the cursor - positive limit does limit the total number of documents to return on cursor. Once limit is reached, cursor should be called automatically by driver. - negative limit is only supported for legacy reason. It sets the batchSize to that negative value.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1156: Properly ensure that none of the server-defined limits on the write commands are exceeded. There is one limit for the number of items that are allowed in each command (maxWriteBatchSize from ismaster). There is a second limit for the number of bytes in the encoded message (maxBsonObjectSize from ismaster), with an exception for a write command containing just a single item, which is allowed to exceed that limit.

Author: agirbal
Comment: [JAVA-293]: Cursor is not closed after limit is fully fetched from server. This turned out to be more of a refactoring than hoped, to clean up code while fixing issue. Solution: - positive batchsize tells server the ideal size of a batch returned - negative batchsize tells server to return 1 batch of maximum that size, or whatever fits in a 4MB batch, and close the cursor - positive limit does limit the total number of documents to return on cursor. Once limit is reached, cursor should be called automatically by driver. - negative limit is only supported for legacy reason. It sets the batchSize to that negative value.

It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Uladzimir Mihura
Comment: JAVA-875: deprecate JMX mechanism

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Comment: Fix reporting _id for Bulk API edge case for pre-2.6 servers

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1156: Properly ensure that none of the server-defined limits on the write commands are exceeded. There is one limit for the number of items that are allowed in each command (maxWriteBatchSize from ismaster). There is a second limit for the number of bytes in the encoded message (maxBsonObjectSize from ismaster), with an exception for a write command containing just a single item, which is allowed to exceed that limit.

Added support in BSONBinaryWriter to encode a document using a DBEncoder.  Added support for insert, update, and delete command for use when writing to a 2.6 server.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-994, JAVA-996, JAVA-998, JAVA-1000, JAVA-1001: Ported Cluster implementation from 3.0.x branch and replaced ConnectionStatus/ReplicaSetStatus/MongosStatus/DynamicConnectionStatus with it.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-871, JAVA-976: Support for MONGODB-X509 authentication mechanism

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-827, JAVA-966: Support SASL PLAIN authentication mechanism

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-845, JAVA-963: Added support for use of a different service name for Kerberos Authentication via GSSAPI. By default, the service name remains mongodb"
column6: but can be altered via the addition of a "SERVICE_NAME" mechanism property to the credential."

Comment: docs: update several deprecated comments

Author: Uladzimir Mihura
Comment: JAVA-893: deprecate classes and methods that will be excluded from 3.x

Comment: JAVA-310: Removed caching of InetSocketAddress in ServerAddress

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-787: Calling OutMessage.doneWithMessage in finally block of DBPort.findOne

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-785: Improve logging for socket connect, read, and write.  As part of this can't say/call something is gone for good and replaced with something more understandable. Also fixed the retry log message to properly report elapsed time
column6: and changed it from severe to warning.  As part of this
column7: restructured the code to make it more intelligible."

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-725: Removing use of deprecated methods/constructors, mostly in tests

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Changed MONGO-CR to MONGODB-CR and authProtocol to authMechanism

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Replacing authentication mechanism enum with String, so that it's extensible in the future

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-757: Adding a new MongoException subclass called WriteConcernException, which DuplicateKey now extends. WriteConcernException takes the command result and passes toString() of it to MongoException, so the JSON representation of the entire document will appear in logs, instead of just the err" field"

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Removed authentication mechanism negotiation.  Renamed MongoAuthenticationProtocol to MongoAuthenticationMechanism

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Renamed MongoCredentials to MongoCredential and moved inner Protocol enum to top level enum MongoAuthenticationProtocol

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Change from STRONGEST to NEGOTIATE.  Removed SERVER-8100 workaround

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Took MongoAuthority and MongoCredentialsStore private (or rather, package-protected).

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Added a better test of DBPort's authentication code

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Finished SASL support. 1. Added support for authProtocol and authSource in MongoClientURI 2. Added support for passing a credentials store to MongoClient containing all the credentials that are needed by this client 3. Re-implemented DB.authenticate using the credentials store and a new authenticate command in DBTCPConnector.  This removes the redundancy in DB and DBPort 4. Added support for negotiated authentication protocol specified by Protocol.STRONGEST

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: Changed class names provisionally by removing 'Client' from MongoClientAuthority and MongoClientCredentials

Author: Jeff Yemin

Comment: JAVA-691: Always acquire write privileges for now.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-691: Added support for GSSAPI authentication over SASL-based Mongo commands.

Author: Brendan W. McAdams
Comment: Replace _authed with a ConcurrentHashMap instead of a synchronized WeakHashMap - There is no reason it ever should have been a Weak HashMap - Synchronizing it causes massive contention for people using authentication - The weak consistency of a Concurrent collection is more than   acceptable here; there should be no reason it causes problems for   people except in edge race conditions.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1156: Properly ensure that none of the server-defined limits on the write commands are exceeded. There is one limit for the number of items that are allowed in each command (maxWriteBatchSize from ismaster). There is a second limit for the number of bytes in the encoded message (maxBsonObjectSize from ismaster), with an exception for a write command containing just a single item, which is allowed to exceed that limit.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1156: Properly ensure that none of the server-defined limits on the write commands are exceeded. There is one limit for the number of items that are allowed in each command (maxWriteBatchSize from ismaster). There is a second limit for the number of bytes in the encoded message (maxBsonObjectSize from ismaster), with an exception for a write command containing just a single item, which is allowed to exceed that limit.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-981, JAVA 1040: Implemented bulk write API using the new write commands from MongoDB 2.6.  Also supports emulation of those commands on pre-2.6 servers using the existing opcode-based writes.  Also fixed the existing support for JAVA-981 in response to changes in the write commands coming in 2.5.5.

Comment: JAVA-381: Added MongosStatus class as a sibling to ReplicaSetStatus to handle mongos failover. Refactored ReplicaSetStatus and MongosStatus to share a common base class ConnectionStatus. Added DynamicConnectionStatus class to handle dynamic discovery of whether a list of seed nodes represents a bunch of mongos servers or a replicaset. Is uses ExecutorService to handle multiple threads that communicate with each member of the seed list. Changed DBTCPConnection to depend on DynamicConnectionStatus insteand of ReplicaSetStatus.

Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-666, JAVA-641: Created two subclasses of DBPortPool: MongoConnectionPool and Java5MongoConnectionPool.  The former is an MBean and the latter is an MXBean.  When creating a DBPortPool, conditionally create one or the other depending on whether java.version system property indicates that this is a 1.5 virtual machine.  This should avoid JXM registration errors when running on Java 5 VMs. Also, by using MongoConnectionPool as the name of the MXBean, avoids incompatibilities in JMX implementations that require the MXBean name to be the same as the MXBean interface that it implements (minus the MXBean suffix).

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-682: Added three new classes--MongoClient, MongoClientOptions, and MongoClientURI, all of which have a default write concern that waits for acknowledgement of the write from the server.  MongoClient extends Mongo so that it's easy to switch to it just by changing which class is constructed.  MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-436: When a database and credentials are specified in the Mongo URI, automatically authenticate the database.  This is done lazily on first use of the database by just setting the credentials on the DB instance. Care is taken to make sure that DB.authenticate and DB.authenticateCommand still work correctly even if credentials are on the URI, so long as the same credentials are used in all cases.  Otherwise clients who were working around this by calling those methods explicitly would break.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-682: Added three new classes--MongoClient, MongoClientOptions, and MongoClientURI, all of which have a default write concern that waits for acknowledgement of the write from the server.  MongoClient extends Mongo so that it's easy to switch to it just by changing which class is constructed.  MongoClientOptions, unlike MongoOptions, is immutable and has a static inner Builder class for construction.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-635: Added MongoInterruptedException, a runtime exception that wraps an InterruptedException.  An instance of this class is thrown in cases where the driver is sleeping or waiting on a condition, and has to catch InterruptedException and do something besides swallowing it.  Since InterruptedException is checked and so can't be thrown from methods that don't declare it, best thing to do it throw a runtime exception that can be handled in the application

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-616: To fix issue with the Semaphore overflowing, made SimplePool class a lot... simpler.   1. Removed support for unlimited pool size.  Now there is a single maximum size of the pool, representing the total number of potentially available and in-use members   2. Semaphore now has one permit for each pool member that are potentially available (either in available list or could be created).   3. Synchronized on this.  Only enter synchronization block in get method if a permit has been acquired   4. Keeping track of list of available members (_avail) and set of checked out members (_out).     Get method removes from _avail or creates new member, and adds to _out.  Done method removes from _out and adds to _avail.   5. Removed debug and track leaks support   6. Updated JMX monitoring interface to reflect the new structure.

Author: Jeff Yemin
Comment: JAVA-1005, JAVA-1003, JAVA-1007, JAVA-1009: Ported PooledConnectionProvider from 3.0.x, and refactored DBPort to work with it by extracting a Connection interface that it implements.  This new connection pool is non-blocking, and supports enforcement of max idle time, max life time, and minimum size.  It also abstracts the JMX monitoring into an implementation of the ConnectionPoolListener interface, which the connection pool fires events to.
